instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]20-00165 SMC issue
threads.message:
I've got this <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. It powers on and runs great but the fan is running at full speed. i ran the onboard hardware test and id came back with some bull shit about there may be an issue with your s.m.c.
check the pic. I did look around for liquid damage and didn't see anything of concern just minor residue on the board( nothing on any chips). 

not really sure where to start on this one. any ideas?

threads.title: [SOLVED]20-00165 SMC issue
threads.message:
One of your sensors is screwed. Without diagnostics it is going to be hard to track down which one it is. You'll need to look hard for corroded traces or components.

I'm not sure, but is there an application which can interrogate the SMC sensors, including power readings ? A bit like OSX temp. You might want to use that to see if that picks up any anomalies.

I can tell you this mac has had a fast fan issue reported as far back as early jan...so someone might have already had a go at cleaning stuff off already.

threads.title: [SOLVED]20-00165 SMC issue
threads.message: im not sure of any app that will do that. i haven't posted this before just got the machine 2 days ago. i will have another go with it under the microscope.

threads.title: [SOLVED]20-00165 SMC issue
threads.message: Usually trackpad sensor. So cable/connector/TP is the first thing to test.

threads.title: [SOLVED]20-00165 SMC issue
threads.message:
haha funny thing is i was telling my self last night i should check the trackpad area. Sure enough found corrosion on the cable and connector cleaned it up and problem solved. 

wish some would would create a piece of software that could read the sensors on these newer boards. Mark problem as solved please

thanks again guys.

threads.title: [SOLVED]20-00165 SMC issue
threads.message: iStat menus will do a reasonable job if it can boot OSX.
